definition: imperial edict/heavenly book (superstition)/obscure or illegible writing/double dutch
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Will books be replaced by computers one day?
sentences.chinese: 某天書將會被電腦所取代嗎？

sentences.english: Will books be replaced by computers ?
sentences.chinese: 將來某天書會被電腦代替嗎？

sentences.english: These unique round impressions have remained an unsolved mystery.
sentences.chinese: 有奇特的無字天書星象圖，留下了無數的不解之謎。

sentences.chinese: 依元字天書所示，上洞八仙將應劫而生。

sentences.english: This is a wordless heavenly book.
Little wonder that westerners said Chinese was a mysterious language.
sentences.chinese: 難怪西方人認爲中文是天書。

sentences.english: As for his eldest sister, she had never stepped into school since birth.
sentences.chinese: 至於大姐，從小到大連一天書也沒有念過。

sentences.english: Although did insurance, contract just like a book from heaven .
sentences.chinese: 即使辦了保險，合同又宛如天書。

sentences.english: Among them, "A Sealed Book Affair" pushed this adoration to the crest.
sentences.chinese: 其中，“天書事件”將對祥瑞的崇奉推向了頂峯。

definition: name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to comment/a point by point commentary
Classic of Mountain and Sea, probably compiled c. 500 BC-200 BC, contains wide range of geography, mythology, witchcraft, popular customs etc
